Question_1.Context: In the process of high energy ball milling (HEBM), various parameters can affect the size of the crystallites produced.
Question_1.Question: Which parameter has the most significant effect on the crystallite size during HEBM?
Question_1.Source: It was established that the MT is the most effective parameter followed by MS and BPWR.

Question_2.Context: The Taguchi method is a systematic approach to optimize process parameters in various manufacturing and material processing techniques.
Question_2.Question: What is the primary advantage of using the Taguchi method over the factorial method?
Question_2.A: It requires testing all possible combinations of parameters.
Question_2.B: It provides a simplified way to set up the combination of experimental parameters.
Question_2.C: It is more time-consuming and complex.
Question_2.D: It does not provide a systematic approach.
Question_2.Source: Compared to the factorial method, instead of testing all possible combinations of parameters available, the Taguchi method provides a more simplified way to set up the combination of experimental parameters.

Question_3.Context: Calcium carbonate (CaCO3) is a widely studied material due to its various applications and properties.
Question_3.Question: For what industrial applications is calcium carbonate (CaCO3) commonly used?
Question_3.B: Paints, inks, coatings, paper products, plastics, and films
Question_3.Source: Calcium carbonate (CaCO3) has innumerable industrial applications: it is used in paints, inks, coatings, paper products, plastics, and films.

Question_4.Context: The crystallite size of materials is an important factor that can influence their properties.
Question_4.Question: What is the typical range of crystallite sizes for CaCO3 when subjected to high energy ball milling (HEBM)?
Question_4.Source: The crystallite size of CaCO3 varied between 140 and 540 nm depending on the HEBM conditions.

Question_5.Context: The Taguchi method uses an orthogonal array (OA) to design experiments for process optimization.
Question_5.Question: What is the purpose of using an orthogonal array (OA) in the Taguchi method?
Question_5.A: To increase the number of experiments required
Question_5.B: To ensure that experiments can be conducted at random
Question_5.C: To provide a structured way to study multiple parameters simultaneously
Question_5.D: To focus on a single parameter at a time
Question_5.Source: The settings of HEBM parameters were determined by using the L9 (33) orthogonal experiments array (OA).

Question_6.Context: The Taguchi method is used to optimize parameters by analyzing the signal-to-noise (S/N) ratio.
Question_6.Question: What does a higher signal-to-noise (S/N) ratio indicate in the context of the Taguchi method?
Question_6.Source: The optimum milling parameter combination was determined by using the analysis of signal-to-noise (S/N) ratio.

Question_7.Context: Analysis of variance (ANOVA) is a statistical method used to analyze differences among group means in a sample.
Question_7.Question: In the context of HEBM, what does ANOVA help to determine?
Question_7.A: The chemical composition of the milled powders
Question_7.B: The significance and percentage of contribution of each milling parameter
Question_7.C: The optimal combination of milling parameters
Question_7.D: The physical properties of the milled powders
Question_7.Source: The analysis of variance (ANOVA) was used to find the significance and percentage of contribution of each milling parameter.

Question_8.Context: The Williamson-Hall (WH) method is a technique used to analyze X-ray diffraction data.
Question_8.Question: What does the Williamson-Hall (WH) method determine from the broadening of XRD peaks?
Question_8.A: The chemical stability of the material
Question_8.B: The phase composition of the material
Question_8.C: The crystallite sizes of the milled powders
Question_8.D: The molecular weight of the material
Question_8.Source: The crystallite sizes of the milled powders were determined from a broadening of XRD peaks by the Williamson-Hall (WH) method.

Question_9.Context: Fourier transform infrared (FTIR) spectroscopy is a technique used to obtain an infrared spectrum of absorption or emission of a solid, liquid, or gas.
Question_9.Question: What information can be confirmed by the absorption peaks observed in FTIR spectroscopy of CaCO3 powders?
Question_9.A: The presence of impurities in the powders
Question_9.B: The crystallite size of the powders
Question_9.C: The presence of CaCO3 in the form of calcite or aragonite
Question_9.D: The exact size of the CaCO3 particles
Question_9.Source: The presence of these bands confirmed that each milled powder was in the form of CaCO3.

Question_10.Context: In the context of material processing, the ball to powder weight ratio (BPWR) is an important parameter in ball milling processes.
Question_10.Question: What effect does the ball to powder weight ratio (BPWR) have in the high energy ball milling process?
Question_10.A: It determines the color of the final product
Question_10.B: It affects the crystallite size of the milled powder
Question_10.C: It changes the chemical composition of the material
Question_10.D: It has no significant effect on the milling process
Question_10.Source: The influences of MS (200, 400, and 600 rpm), MT (5, 10, and 30 h) and BPWR (10:1, 20:1, and 50:1 on the crystallite size of CaCO3 powder were investigated.
